intro: Ferula longipes, commonly known as the longipes cowbane, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, feathery leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Ferula longipes is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low precipitation and high temperatures. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native range.
